review: Although the idea behind the product is pretty cool, I was expecting quite a bit more from it. I was under the impression that the Chromecast came pre-loaded with apps such as Netflix that allowed me to watch my movies/shows without the assistance of my laptop or phone. This may be because I have only played with it for a few minutes so if someone else can give me some help with figuring that out, I may like it a bit more. Also, I am not sure if this is my TV or the Chromecast, but for some reason, my TV seems to switch inputs after awhile and switch to the next input. It's never done that before, so I am not sure if it's the Chromecast disconnecting or something like that. I also don't like that the Chromecast has to be plugged in to both the wall and into my TV. That's kind of a pain as well.
author: Alisa Bennett

review: Works well. It does require the additional HDMI extension plug that came with it for it to work on an older Sony projection TV (60").There's just a lot of stuff Google could improve which would make the Chromecast better.Sometimes it's really slow when it comes to loading a Youtube video -- and this is when it's about 2 ft away from the AT&T; router.Also, some video files seem to have no sound when casted through Chrome (most up to date version of both Chrome & OS X).Some videos hiccup for a split second in visually intense scenes -- even on 480 videos.I wish there were other ways to control what I'm casting. Right now, when I cast form device A (for instance a Macbook), only device A gives me control over the casted content.I'd like to be able to control pause/play/volume etc. (or even better simply control the entire casted content) via my Android phone. It can't be that hard for Google to develop a Chromecast remote control app (like RemoteCast).
